name: Acid Splash
summary: It deals Acid damage to enemies in a small area.
description: Throw a bubble of acid that damages each creature it hits.
higherLevels:
When the spellcaster reaches Level 5, the damage increases by another d6|Acid Acid|1d6 Acid damage, for a total of 2d6|Acid.
When the spellcaster reaches Level 10, the damage increases by another d6|Acid Acid|1d6 Acid damage, for a total of 3d6|Acid.

name: Aid
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to heal and embolden their allies and themselves with resolve. Affected creatures have their maximum Hit Points increased for the duration of the spell.
description: Bolster your allies with toughness and resolve to heal and increase their Hit Points maximum.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level increases the target's maximum health by an additional 5|Healing for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.

name: Animal Friendship
summary: This spell charms a beast and convinces it you mean no harm.
description:
Convince a beast not to attack you.

The creature must have an Intelligence of 3 or less.
Condition ends early if you or an ally hurts the target.
In higher difficulty modes, the target might become hostile when the spell ends.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affects an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Animate Dead
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to animate a corpse to create an undead servant.
description:
Animate a corpse to create an undead servant while not in combat.

The target must be a Medium or Small corpse.

variants.name: Animate Dead: Skeleton
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to animate a corpse to create a skeleton|Skeleton that focuses on ranged weaponry. They must target a corpse, and the skeleton lasts until killed or until the next long rest.
variants.description:
Create a Skeleton that specialises in ranged combat.

The target must be a Medium or Small corpse.

variants.name: Animate Dead: Skeleton Squad
variants.summary: This spell is a higher level version of Animate Dead: Skeleton that can summon 3 skeletons instead of 1. Accordingly, the user must also target 3 corpses for this instead of 1.
variants.description:
Create 3 Skeletons that specialise in ranged combat.

The target must be a Medium or Small corpse.

variants.name: Animate Dead: Zombie
variants.summary:
This spell allows spellcasters to animate a corpse to create a Zombie that specializes in melee combat. They must target a corpse, and the zombie lasts until killed or until the next long rest.

This spell is a variation of Animate Dead.
variants.description:
Create a Zombie that specialises in melee combat.

The target must be a Medium or Small corpse.

variants.name: Animate Dead: Zombie Batallion
variants.summary: This spell is a higher level version of Animate Dead: Zombie that can summon 3 Zombies instead of 1. Accordingly, the user must also target 3 corpses for this instead of 1.
variants.description:
Create 3 Zombies that specialises in melee combat.

The targets must be a Medium or Small corpse.

variants.name: Animate Dead: Ghoul
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to animate a corpse to create a ghoul|Ghoul (Animate Dead). Requires a corpse, and lasts until long rest.
variants.description:
Create a ghoul that specialises in melee combat.

The target must be a Medium or Small corpse.

variants.name: Animate Dead: Ghoul Pack
variants.summary: This spell is a higher level version of Animate Dead: Ghoul that can summon 3 Ghouls instead of 1. Accordingly, the user must also target 3 corpses for this instead of 1.
variants.description:
Create 3 Ghouls that specialises in melee combat.

The targets must be a Medium or Small corpse.

variants.name: Animate Dead: Flying Ghoul
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to animate a corpse to create a flying ghoul. Requires a corpse, and lasts until long rest.
variants.description:
Create a flying ghoul that specialises in ranged combat.

The target must be a Medium or Small corpse.

variants.name: Animate Dead: Flying Ghoul Flock
variants.summary: This spell is a higher level version of Animate Dead: Flying Ghoul that can summon 3 Flying Ghouls instead of 1. Accordingly, the user must also target 3 corpses for this instead of 1.
variants.description:
Create 3 Flying Ghouls that specialises in melee combat.

The targets must be a Medium or Small corpse.

name: Arcane Gate
description:
Create two linked teleportation portals within range. All creatures, including enemies, may travel between the two portals as a free action.

The game's pathfinding will automatically navigate through a portal if it is the shorter route.

name: Arcane Lock
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to magically lock a container.
description: Close a door or container with a magical lock. It can no longer be lockpicked or opened with Knock.

name: Armour of Agathys
summary: It allows spellcasters to create a spectral armour of frost that covers the caster and their equipment. The armour provides additional Hit Points to the caster and damages hostile targets while the added Hit Points are present.
description:
Gain 5 and deal 5|Cold Cold|damage to any creature that hits you with a melee attack.

Can only have Temporary Hit Points from one source.
higherLevels: Upcast: Gain an additional 5 and deal an additional 5 Cold damage per level.

name: Arms of Hadar
summary: This spell allows the caster to summon dark tendrils and deal Necrotic damage to enemies in an area centered on the caster, preventing them from taking reactions.
description:
Prevent targets from using reactions. 

On Save: Targets still take half damage but are able to use reactions.
higherLevels: Upcast: Deals an additional 1d6|Necrotic damage per level.

name: Bane
summary: This spell allows the caster to temporarily curse enemies, making their attacks miss more often and weakening their Saving Throws.
description: Up to 3 creatures receive a d4|Physical -1d4 penalty to Attack Rolls and SavingThrows.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affects an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Banishing Smite
summary: This spells allows spellcasters to imbue their weapon with power, dealing force damage and possibly Banishing the target.
description:
Possibly Banish your target to another plane of existence.

Targets with 50 Hit Points or more can't be Banished.

variants.name: Banishing Smite (Melee)
variants.summary: This spells allows spellcasters to imbue their weapon with power, dealing force damage and possibly Banishing the target.
variants.description:
Possibly Banish your target to another plane of existence.

Targets with 50 Hit Points or more can't be Banished.

variants.name: Banishing Smite (Ranged)
variants.summary: This spells allows spellcasters to imbue their weapon with power, dealing force damage and possibly Banishing the target.
variants.description:
Possibly Banish your target to another plane of existence.

Targets with 50 Hit Points or more can't be Banished.

name: Banishment
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily send a target to another plane of existence.
description: Temporarily Banish your target to another plane of existence.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affect an additional target per level.

name: Barkskin
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to fortify the defense of a willing creature and increase their Armour Class. While under the effect of this spell, the target's skin has a bark-like texture.
description: Touch a willing creature to toughen its skin and increase its Armour Class up to 16.

name: Beacon of Hope
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to bolster their allies with hope and vitality.
description: Your allies will regain the maximum Hit Points possible when healed. They also gain Advantage on Wisdom SavingThrows and Death Saving Throws.

name: Bestow Curse
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to curse a target with their touch.
description:
Curse a creature with your touch. The curse either bestows Disadvantage on Checks and SavingThrows, Disadvantage on Attack Rolls, lets you deal additional damage to the target, or robs it of its Actions.

The effect of the curse is based on the variant selected, and lasts for 10 turns.
higherLevels: Upcast: The duration is increased by 10 turns for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.

variants.name: Bestow Curse: Dread
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to curse a target with dread, causing them to possibly skip their turn.
variants.description: Curse a creature with your touch. It fills with dread, possibly skipping its turn.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: The duration is increased by 10 turns for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.

variants.name: Bestow Curse: Additional Damage
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to curse a target, causing them to take additional damage from their attacks and spells.
variants.description: Curse a creature with your touch. Your attacks and spells deal an additional 1d8|Necrotic damage to the target.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: The duration is increased by 10 turns for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.

variants.name: Bestow Curse: Attack Disadvantage
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to curse a target, causing their attacks against the caster to have Disadvantage.
variants.description: Curse a creature with your touch. It has Disadvantage on Attack Rolls against you.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: The duration is increased by 10 turns for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.

variants.name: Bestow Curse: Strength Disadvantage
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to curse a target, causing it to suffer Disadvantage on Strength Checks and Saving Throws.
variants.description: Curse a creature with your touch. It suffers Disadvantage on Strength Checks and SavingThrows.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: The duration is increased by 10 turns for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.

variants.name: Bestow Curse: Dexterity Disadvantage
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to curse a target, causing it to suffer Disadvantage on Dexterity Checks and Saving Throws.
variants.description: Curse a creature with your touch. It suffers Disadvantage on Dexterity Checks and SavingThrows.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: The duration is increased by 10 turns for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.

variants.name: Bestow Curse: Constitution Disadvantage
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to curse a target, causing it to suffer Disadvantage on Constitution Checks and Saving Throws.
variants.description: Curse a creature with your touch. It suffers Disadvantage on Constitution Checks and SavingThrows.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: The duration is increased by 10 turns for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.

variants.name: Bestow Curse: Intelligence Disadvantage
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to curse a target, causing it to suffer Disadvantage on Intelligence Checks and Saving Throws.
variants.description: Curse a creature with your touch. It suffers Disadvantage on Intelligence Checks and SavingThrows.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: The duration is increased by 10 turns for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.

variants.name: Bestow Curse: Wisdom Disadvantage
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to curse a target, causing it to suffer Disadvantage on Wisdom Checks and Saving Throws.
variants.description: Curse a creature with your touch. It suffers Disadvantage on Wisdom Checks and SavingThrows.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: The duration is increased by 10 turns for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.

variants.name: Bestow Curse: Charisma Disadvantage
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to curse a target, causing it to suffer Disadvantage on Charisma Checks and Saving Throws.
variants.description: Curse a creature with your touch. It suffers Disadvantage on Charisma Checks and SavingThrows.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: The duration is increased by 10 turns for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.

name: Blade Barrier
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to summon a wall of cutting blades.
description: Summons a wall of razor-sharp blades that turns the area into Difficult Terrain and damages anyone foolish enough to come close.

name: Blade Ward
summary: It allows spellcasters to become more resilient against physical damage.
description: Take only half the damage from Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing attacks.

name: Bless
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily bolster themselves and their alliesâ€™ attacks and Saving Throws.
description: Bless up to 3 creatures. They gain a d4|Slashing +1d4 bonus to Attack Rolls and SavingThrows.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affects an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Blight
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to drain the moisture and vitality from a target creature using necromantic energy. It's especially effective versus plants.
description:
Deals 8d8|Necrotic to a target. Plants take maximum damage from this spell, and have Disadvantage on the SavingThrow against it.

On Save: Target still takes half damage.

No effect on undead and constructs.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Necrotic damage for each Spell Slot Level above 4th.

name: Blinding Smite
summary: Blinding Smite allows a Paladin to expend a Spell Slot to deal additional Radiant damage with a melee weapon attack and possibly blind their target..
description: Evoke a heavenly flare and possibly Blind your target

name: Blindness
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to magically Blind a targeted hostile creature.
description:
Limit a foe's sight range. It is easier to hit, and the creature will miss more often.

Attack Rolls against it have Advantage and the foe attacks with Disadvantage.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affects an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.

name: Blink
summary: This spell allows the spellcaster to travel to the Ethereal Plane, becoming temporarily unassailable and unseen until they return.
description:
Available only in combat.

At the end of your turn, roll a  d20. On 11 or higher, you vanish into the Ethereal Plane. While there, you can't be harmed or seen in this world. 

When you do vanish, your presence here is a representation of the location you'll come back to. You can choose to teleport it up to m=6|ft=20.

name: Blur
summary: This spell Blurs the spellcaster's body and makes them harder to hit.
description:
Your body becomes Blurred. Attackers have Disadvantage on Attack Rolls against you.

Doesn't affect creatures that don't rely on sight or that can see through illusions.

name: Bone Chill
summary: It deals Necrotic damage and prevents the target from regaining Hit Points.
description: Prevent the target from healing until your next turn. An undead target receives Disadvantage on Attack Rolls.
higherLevels:
When the spellcaster reaches Level 5, the damage increases by another d8|Necrotic Necrotic|1d8 Necrotic damage, for a total of 2d8|Necrotic.
When the spellcaster reaches Level 10, the damage increases by another d8|Necrotic Necrotic|1d8 Necrotic damage, for a total of 3d8|Necrotic.

name: Branding Smite
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to cause their weapon to gleam with astral radiance, allow them to mark targets with light, preventing them from turning Invisible
description:
Your weapon gleams with astral radiance as you strike and possibly mark your targets with light, preventing it from turning Invisible. 

* This spell, unlike other Smite Spells, will work with Ranged weaponry.
higherLevels: Deals an additional 1d6|Radiant damage per level.

variants.name: Branding Smite (Melee)
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Branding Smite. It allows spellcasters to cause their melee weapon to gleam with astral radiance, allow them to mark targets with light, preventing them from turning Invisible
variants.description:
Your melee weapon gleams with astral radiance as you strike and possibly mark your targets with light, preventing it from turning Invisible. 

* If the spellcaster misses the initial Attack, the spell slot and bonus are not consumed. This spell, unlike other Smite Spells, will work with Ranged weaponry.
variants.higherLevels: Deals an additional 1d6|Radiant damage per level.

variants.name: Branding Smite (Ranged)
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Branding Smite. It allows spellcasters to cause their ranged weapon to gleam with astral radiance, allow them to mark targets with light, preventing them from turning Invisible
variants.description:
Your ranged weapon gleams with astral radiance as you strike and possibly mark your targets with light, preventing it from turning Invisible. 

* This spell, unlike other Smite Spells, will work with Ranged weaponry.
variants.higherLevels: Deals an additional 1d6|Radiant damage per level.

name: Burning Hands
summary: It allows spellcasters to shoot a flaming cone from their fingertips and deal Fire damage to enemies.
description:
Each flammable target is hit with 3d6|Fire Fire|damage.

On Save: Targets still take half damage.
higherLevels: Upcast: Deals an additional Fire|1d6 Fire damage per level.

name: Call Lightning
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to call down lightning to hit all targets within range. The spellcaster can also continue to call down lightning repeatedly on subsequent turns.
description: Call down lightning to hit all targets within range and its area of effect for 3d10|Lightning damage.
higherLevels: Upcast: When the spell is cast using a 4th level spell slot or higher, damage increases by 1d10|Lightning for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.

name: Calm Emotions
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to magically subdue intense emotions in targeted creatures. The affected target becomes neutral to the creatures it is hostile toward. It also cannot be Charmed or Frightened during the duration of the spell.
description: Humanoids can't be Charmed, Frightened, or become enraged.

name: Chain Lightning
description: Strike an enemy with lightning. Three more bolts will leap from the target, electrifying as many as three other enemies within range.

name: Charm Person
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily charm a humanoid creature, granting Advantage on Charisma Checks.
description:
Charm a humanoid to prevent it from attacking you. You gain Advantage on Charisma Checks in dialogue.

Enemies have Advantage on SavingThrows against being Charmed.

Condition ends early if you or an ally hurts the target.
In higher difficulty modes, the target might accuse you of enchanting them.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affect an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Chromatic Orb
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to fire a ball of energy and deal the desired damage type to enemies.
description:
Hurl a sphere of energy.

It deals 3d8|Thunder damage, or 2d8 Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning or Poison damage and creates a surface.
higherLevels: * Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra d8|Physical 1d8 damage of the chosen type for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

variants.name: Chromatic Orb: Thunder
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Chromatic Orb. This variant allows spellcasters to hurl a ball of thunder, dealing Thunder damage.
variants.description: Hurl a sphere of energy that deals 3d8|Thunder damage.
variants.higherLevels: * Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Thunder damage for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

variants.name: Chromatic Orb: Acid
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Chromatic Orb. This variant allows spellcasters to hurl a globe of acid, dealing Acid damage and creating an Acid Surface.
variants.description: Hurl a sphere of energy that deals 2d8|Acid damage and creates an Acid Surface.
variants.higherLevels: * Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Acid damage for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

variants.name: Chromatic Orb: Cold
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Chromatic Orb. This variant allows spellcasters to hurl a globe of cold energy, dealing Cold damage and creating an Ice Surface.
variants.description: Hurl a sphere of energy that deals 2d8|Cold damage and creates an Ice Surface.
variants.higherLevels: * Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Cold damage for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

variants.name: Chromatic Orb: Fire
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Chromatic Orb. This variant allows spellcasters to hurl a ball of fire, dealing Fire damage and creating a Fire Surface.
variants.description: Hurl a sphere of energy that deals 2d8|Fire damage and creates a Fire Surface.
variants.higherLevels: * Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Fire damage for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

variants.name: Chromatic Orb: Lightning
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Chromatic Orb. This variant allows spellcasters to hurl a ball of electricity, dealing Lightning damage and creating an Electrified Surface.
variants.description: Hurl a sphere of energy that deals 2d8|Lightning damage and creates an Electrified Surface.
variants.higherLevels: * Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Lightning damage for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

variants.name: Chromatic Orb: Poison
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Chromatic Orb. This variant allows spellcasters to hurl an orb of poison, dealing Poison damage and creating a Poison Surface.
variants.description: Hurl a sphere of energy that deals 2d8|Poison damage and creates a Poison Surface.
variants.higherLevels: * Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Poison damage for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Circle of Death
description: Sculpt a massive sphere of entropic energy around a creature. Devastate the target and all surrounding creatures.

name: Cloud of Daggers
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to conjure a barrage of daggers in an area that deal Slashing damage to any creature entering or starting their turn in the area.
description: Conjure a cloud of spinning daggers that attack anyone inside.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 2d4|Slashing damage for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.

name: Cloudkill
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to conjure a moveable cloud that damages and obscures everything it envelops.
description: Craft a large cloud that inflicts 5d8|Poison damage per turn. You can reposition the cloud every turn. The cloud Heavily Obscures everything within it.

name: Colour Spray
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily blind enemies with flashing coloured light, making their attacks miss more often and shortening their attack range.
description: Blind creatures up to a combined Healing|33 Hit Points.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level increases the number of targets by 1 and total Hit Points by 11 for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Command
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to order their target to flee, move closer, freeze, drop to the ground, or drop their weapon.
description: Command a creature to flee, move closer, freeze, drop to the ground or drop its weapon. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw in order to resist the effects.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affects an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

variants.name: Command: Approach
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Command. It allows spellcasters to order their target to temporarily approach and do nothing else.
variants.description: Command a creature to move toward you on its turn and do nothing else.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: Affects an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

variants.name: Command: Drop
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Command. It allows spellcasters to order their target to drop their weapon and do nothing else.
variants.description: Command a creature to drop their weapon on its turn and do nothing else.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: Affects an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

variants.name: Command: Flee
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Command. It allows spellcasters to order their target to temporarily flee and do nothing else.
variants.description: Command a creature to flee from you on its turn and do nothing else.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: Affects an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

variants.name: Command: Grovel
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to order their target to temporarily fall Prone and do nothing else.
variants.description: Command a creature to fall Prone on its turn and do nothing else.

variants.name: Command: Halt
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Command. It allows spellcasters to order their target temporarily from moving or taking Actions, Bonus Actions, or Reactions.
variants.description: Command a creature to halt, preventing it from moving or taking any type of action.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: Affects an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Compelled Duel
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to compel an enemy to ignore other targets and attack only the spellcaster.
description: Force an enemy to attack only you, giving it Disadvantage against other targets.

name: Cone of Cold
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to blast icy air into a region in front of them, damaging affected creatures and turning existing water surfaces into Ice Surface.
description: Make a flurry of frost, crisp air, and condensed snow crystals erupt from your hands.
higherLevels: Upcast: The damage is increased by 1d8|Cold for each Spell Slot Level above 5th.

name: Confusion
summary: This spell allows spellcaster to confuse a group of creatures, drastically reducing their effectiveness in combat.
description: Befuddle a group of creatures, causing them to attack at random, wander around aimlessly, and occasionally skip turns in the stupor.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affects a larger area at higher levels.

name: Conjure Barrage
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to summon a barrage of blades in front of them, potentially hitting multiple enemies.
description:
Channel your weapon's essence into a destructive, widespread volley. Deal Physical|Weapon Damage, plus an additional d8|Physical 2d8 damage of the same Type to enemies within a cone in front of you. This spell can be cast with either your melee weapon or ranged weapon.

On a successful Dexterity SavingThrow, targets still take half damage.

variants.name: Conjure Barrage: Melee Weapon
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to summon a barrage of blades in front of them, potentially hitting multiple enemies. This spell is a variant of Conjure Barrage.
variants.description:
Channel your weapon's essence into a destructive, widespread volley. Deal your melee weapon's Physical|Weapon Damage, plus an additional d8|Physical 2d8 damage of the same Type to enemies within a cone in front of you.

On a successful Dexterity SavingThrow, targets still take half damage.

variants.name: Conjure Barrage: Ranged Weapon
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to summon a barrage of blades in front of them, potentially hitting multiple enemies. This spell is a variant of Conjure Barrage.
variants.description:
Channel your weapon's essence into a destructive, widespread volley. Deal your ranged weapon's Physical|Weapon Damage, plus an additional d8|physical 2d8 damage of the same Type to enemies within a cone in front of you.

On a successful Dexterity SavingThrow, targets still take half damage.

name: Conjure Elemental
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to summon a Fire, Earth, Water, or Air Elemental.
description: Bend the barrier between the Planes until they disgorge an elemental ally to follow and fight for you.
higherLevels: At level 6, the spellcaster can summon an Air Myrmidon, Earth Myrmidon, Fire Myrmidon, or Water Myrmidon.

variants.name: Conjure Elemental: Air Elemental
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Conjure Elemental. This variant allows spellcasters to summon an Air Elemental.
variants.description: The air elemental can use Primordial Gales, Gushing Air, and can Shock your foes.

variants.name: Conjure Elemental: Earth Elemental
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Conjure Elemental. This variant allows spellcasters to summon an Earth Elemental.
variants.description: The earth elemental can use Seismic Strike, Soil-Clogged Slam, and can create sludgy mud surfaces while walloping your foes.

variants.name: Conjure Elemental: Fire Elemental
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Conjure Elemental. This variant allows spellcasters to summon a Fire Elemental.
variants.description: The fire elemental can use Smouldering Touch, Erupting Cinder, and can make your foes Burn.

variants.name: Conjure Elemental: Water Elemental
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Conjure Elemental. This variant allows spellcasters to summon a Water Elemental.
variants.description: The water elemental can use Winter's Breath, Slam, and can mete out cold punishment upon foes with its fists.

variants.name: Conjure Elemental: Air Myrmidon
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Conjure Elemental. This variant allows spellcasters to summon an Air Myrmidon.
variants.description: The myrmidon can cast Invisibility, Electrified Flail, and Raging Vortex.

variants.name: Conjure Elemental: Earth Myrmidon
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Conjure Elemental. This variant allows spellcasters to summon an Earth Myrmidon.
variants.description: The myrmidon can cast Muck to Metal, Sludgy Sling, and Burrow.

variants.name: Conjure Elemental: Fire Myrmidon
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Conjure Elemental. This variant allows spellcasters to summon a Fire Myrmidon.
variants.description: The myrmidon can cast Scorching Strike, Myrmidon's Immolation, and Cinderous Swipe.

variants.name: Conjure Elemental: Water Myrmidon
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Conjure Elemental. This variant allows spellcasters to summon a Water Myrmidon.
variants.description: The myrmidon can cast Hiemal Strike, Healing Vapours, and Explosive Icicle.

name: Conjure Minor Elemental
summary: Conjure 2 Mud Mephits, 2 Ice Mephites, or an Azer to fight for you.
description: Conjure a minor elemental to fight alongside you.

variants.name: Conjure Minor Elemental: Azer
variants.summary: It is a variant of Conjure Minor Elemental that summons an Azer.
variants.description: Conjure an Azer from the Plane of Fire. It deals both Bludgeoning and Fire damage with its warhammer, and can Overheat.

variants.name: Conjure Minor Elemental: Ice Mephits
variants.summary: It is a variant of Conjure Minor Elemental that summons two Ice Mephits.
variants.description: Conjure two Ice Mephits from the Elemental Chaos. They can Hurl and Exhale ice, and Explode when they die.

variants.name: Conjure Minor Elemental: Mud Mephits
variants.summary: It is a variant of Conjure Minor Elemental that summons two Mud Mephits.
variants.description: Conjure two Mud Mephits from the Elemental Chaos. They can Breath Mud and Explode when they die.

name: Conjure Woodland Being
summary: This spell summons a Dryad to fight alongside the caster.
description:
Conjure a Dryad to fight alongside you.
She can use Nature's Step, Entangle enemies, and summon a Wood Woad.

name: Contagion
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to infect their target with an affliction of their choosing, potentially resulting in the target contracting a disease.
description:
Poison a target and possibly afflict them with a disease of your choice.

Once infected, the target will roll a Constitution SavingThrow each turn. If it accumulates 3 successes, it recovers. If it accumulates 3 failures, it contracts the Disease chosen by the spellcaster.

variants.name: Contagion: Filth Fever
variants.summary: This spell is a variation of the Level 5 Necromancy Spell, Contagion. It allows spellcasters to Poison an enemy, with the possibility of the affliction progressing into a Disease which saps target's Strength.
variants.description: Poison a target and possibly afflict them with a Disease. When cast, the target receives Contagion Poisoned.

variants.name: Contagion: Flesh Rot
variants.summary: This spell is a variation of the Level 5 Necromancy Spell, Contagion. It allows spellcasters to Poison an enemy, with the possibility of the affliction progressing into a Disease which saps target's Charisma.
variants.description: Poison a target and possibly afflict them with a Disease. When cast, the target receives Contagion Poisoned.

variants.name: Contagion: Slimy Doom
variants.summary: This spell is a variation of the Level 5 Necromancy Spell, Contagion. It allows spellcasters to Poison an enemy, with the possibility of the affliction progressing into a Disease which saps target's Constitution.
variants.description: Poison a target and possibly afflict them with a Disease. When cast, the target receives Contagion Poisoned.

variants.name: Contagion: Seizure
variants.summary: This spell is a variation of the Level 5 Necromancy Spell, Contagion. It allows spellcasters to Poison an enemy, with the possibility of the affliction progressing into a Disease which saps target's Dexterity.
variants.description: Poison a target and possibly afflict them with a Disease. When cast, the target receives Contagion Poisoned.

variants.description: Poison a target and possibly afflict them with a Disease. When cast, the target receives Contagion Poisoned.

variants.name: Contagion: Blinding Sickness
variants.summary: This spell is a variation of the Level 5 Necromancy Spell, Contagion. It allows spellcasters to Poison an enemy, with the possibility of the affliction progressing into a Disease which saps target's Wisdom.
variants.description: Poison a target and possibly afflict them with a Disease. When cast, the target receives Contagion Poisoned.

name: Counterspell
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to interrupt another caster's spellcasting, causing it to fail and have no effect.
description: Nullify another creature's spell as a reaction. The spell must be 3rd Level or lower. If it is higher, you must succeed a Check to nullify it, the difficulty of which is based on the spell's Level.

name: Create Undead
description: Create a corpse as a heinous mummy that fights by your side.

name: Create or Destroy Water
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to conjure or destroy an area of water (or water-like surfaces).
description: Choose to call forth rain or destroy a water-based surface.
higherLevels: Upcast: When the spell is cast a 2nd Level or higher, the area that you can create or destroy water increases by 2m / 5ft for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

variants.name: Create Water
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Create or Destroy Water that allows spellcasters to conjure an area of water that rain from thin air and forms a water surface. Creatures standing in the area when the spell is cast will become Wet.
variants.description: Call forth rain. It extinguishes exposed flames and forms a Water Surface.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: When the spell is cast a 2nd Level or higher, the area that you can create water increases by 2m / 5ft for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

variants.name: Destroy Water
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Create or Destroy Water that  allows spellcasters to destroy an area of water (or water-like surfaces). The spell will remove the Wet condition from creatures within its area of effect.
variants.description: Cause water-based surfaces (such as water, steam, ice, blood and poison) to vanish.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: When the spell is cast a 2nd Level or higher, the area that you can destroy water increases by 2m / 5ft for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Crown of Madness
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily charm a humanoid creature and induce madness in their mind. The affected creature will make a melee attack against any creature within its reach.
description: Instill madness in a humanoid enemy, making them attack the creature closest to them (other than you), even if it's allied.

name: Crusader's Mantle
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to imbue their allies' weapons with holy power, causing them to deal additional Radiant damage.
description: Radiate a holy power that emboldens nearby allies. Their weapon attacks deal an additional 1d4|Radiant damage.

name: Cure Wounds
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to heal allies with divine magic through touch.
description:
Healing|Heal a creature you can touch.

No effect on undead and constructs.
higherLevels: Upcast: Heals an additional 1d8|Healing for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Dancing Lights
summary: It creates magical orbs of light that brighten an area.
description: Illuminate a m=9|ft=30 radius.

name: Darkness
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to conjure a cloud of darkness in an area within range that obscures and blinds those within it.
description: Create a cloud of magical darkness that Heavily Obscures and Blinds creatures within. Creatures cannot make ranged attacks into or out of it.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level doesn't grant any additional benefits.

name: Darkvision
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to alter a creature's sight, granting them the ability to see in the dark.
description: Grant a creature the ability to see in the dark out to a range of m=12|ft=40.

name: Daylight
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to dispel darkness by summoning a sphere of light or enchanting an item to shine like the sun.
description: Enchant an item to shine like the sun or summon a sphere of sunlight that dispels all darkness around it.

variants.name: Daylight: Sphere
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of the spell Daylight This variant allows spellcasters to dispel darkness by summoning a sphere of light.
variants.description:
Summon a sphere of sunlight that dispels all darkness around it. The sphere cannot be moved.

Until Long Rest

variants.name: Daylight: Enchant Item
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of the spell Daylight. This variant of the spell allows spellcasters to enchant an item to shine like the sun.
variants.description: Enchant an item or weapon to shine with the light of the sun and dispel all darkness around it. Target must have a weapon in their main hand.

name: Death Ward
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to prevent a target from dying.
description: Protect a creature from death. The next time damage would reduce it to 0 Hit Points, it remains conscious with 1 Hit Point left.

name: Destructive Wave
summary: This spell allows the caster to create a massive shockwave that damages all creatures and can possibly knock them prone.
description: Create a shockwave of either divine or malevolent thunder that damages nearby creatures and possibly knocks them Prone.

name: Detect Thoughts
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to telepathically link to unprotected minds and hear the thoughts of targeted creatures while talking to them.
description: Focus your mind to read the thoughts of certain creatures while talking to them.

name: Dimension Door
summary: This spell teleports you and an ally.
description: Teleport yourself and up to one adjacent ally to a place you can see. The ally cannot be larger than Medium.

name: Disguise Self
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily change their appearance. While active, gain access to the action Dispel Disguise to end the effect.
description: Magically change all aspects of your appearance.

name: Disintegrate
description: Shoot a thin green ray from your finger. If the spell reduces the target to 0 hit points, it disintegrates into a crumbly ash.

name: Dispel Evil and Good
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to protect themselves from Evil and Good creatures, and allows them to break Enchantments on allies.
description: Aberrations, Celestials, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, and Undead have Disadvantage on Attack Rolls against you. You can also break Enchantments that Charm, Frighten, or Possesses allies.

name: Dissonant Whispers
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to fill a target with terror and deal Psychic damage to them.
description:
Frighten a creature: it will be easier to hit and cannot move.

On a successful Wisdom saving throw, the creature only takes half damage.
higherLevels: Upcast: Deal an additional  1d6 | Psychic damage per level.

name: Divine Favour
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to empower their Weapons to deal extra Radiant|Radiant damage.
description: Your prayer empowers you with divine radiance. Your weapons deal an additional 1d4|Radiant damage.

name: Divine Smite
summary: Divine Smite allows a Paladin to expend a Spell Slot to deal additional Radiant damage with a melee weapon attack.
description: Your weapon emanates divine might as you strike, dealing an additional 2d8|Radiant|drs=t damage. Deals an additional 1d8|Radiant|drs=t damage to Fiends and Undead.
higherLevels: * When Divine Smite is cast at 2nd Level or higher, damage increases by 1d8|Radiant for each Spell Slot Level above 1st. This damage is capped to 5d8, so using a spell slot above 4th spell level adds no further damage.

name: Dominate Beast
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to temporarily charm a Beast into fighting alongside the caster, rather than against them.
description: Make a Beast fight alongside you. Every time the Beast takes damage, it makes a Wisdom SavingThrow against your domination.

name: Dominate Person
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to force a humanoid to temporarily fight as an ally.
description: Make a humanoid fight alongside you. Every time the creature takes damage, it makes a Wisdom SavingThrow against your domination. Allies cannot be dominated.

name: Eldritch Blast
summary: The cantrip allows the spellcaster to shoot out an energy beam that deals Force damage, and that can be upgraded with Warlock abilities.
description: Conjure a beam of crackling energy. Deals 1d10|Force damage to a target.
higherLevels:
The spell creates multiple beams at higher levels: 1d10|Force|per=ray
* 2 beams at Level 5 (scales on character level, sum of all class levels)
* 3 beams at Level 10 (same)
You can either target a single creature or multiple creatures with the beams. Each beam rolls a separate Attack Roll.

name: Elemental Weapon
summary: This spell imbues a weapon with a chosen energy type, increasing its damage and accuracy.
description: Imbue a weapon with elemental power. It receives a +1 bonus to Attack Rolls and Damage Rollsd4|Physical 1d4 damage of your choice.

variants.name: Elemental Weapon: Acid
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Elemental Weapon and imbues a weapon with corrosive might, granting it bonus Acid|Acid damage and a +1 Enchantment.
variants.description: Imbue a weapon with corrosive might. It receives a +1 bonus to Attack Rolls and Damage Rolls1d4|Acid damage.

variants.name: Elemental Weapon: Cold
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Elemental Weapon and imbues a weapon with icy might, granting it bonus Cold|Cold damage and a +1 Enchantment.
variants.description: Imbue a weapon with an icy might. It receives a +1 bonus to Attack Rolls and Damage Rolls1d4|Cold damage.

variants.name: Elemental Weapon: Fire
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Elemental Weapon and imbues a weapon with fiery might, granting it bonus Fire|Fire damage and a +1 Enchantment.
variants.description: Imbue a weapon with fiery might. It receives a +1 bonus to Attack Rolls and Damage Rolls1d4|Fire damage.

variants.name: Elemental Weapon: Lightning
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Elemental Weapon and imbues a weapon with electrical might, granting it bonus Lightning|Lightning damage and a +1 Enchantment.
variants.description: Imbue a weapon with an electrical might. It receives a +1 bonus to Attack Rolls and Damage Rolls1d4|Lightning damage.

variants.name: Elemental Weapon: Thunder
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of Elemental Weapon and imbues a weapon with thunderous might, granting it bonus Thunder|Thunder damage and a +1 Enchantment.
variants.description: Imbue a weapon with thunderous might. It receives a +1 bonus to Attack Rolls and Damage Rolls1d4|Thunder damage.

name: Enhance Ability
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to strengthen an aspect of a creature's physical or mental attributes.
description: Bestow a magical enchantment upon an ally. They gain Advantage on Ability Checks with a chosen Ability.
higherLevels: Upcast: When this Spell is cast at 3rd level or higher, you can target an additional creature for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.

variants.name: Bear's Endurance
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to bestow a creature the fortitude of a bear. Affected creatures gain Temporary Hit Points and Advantage on Constitution Checks.
variants.description: Creature gains Advantage on Constitution Checks and gains 7 Temporary Hit Points.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: When this Spell is cast at 3rd level or higher, you can target an additional creature for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.

variants.name: Bull's Strength
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to bestow a creature the might of a bull. Affected creatures have their Carrying Capacity doubled and gain Advantage on Strength Checks.
variants.description: Creature gains Advantage on Strength Checks and its Weight Limit is doubled.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: When this Spell is cast at 3rd level or higher, you can target an additional creature for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.

variants.name: Cat's Grace
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to bestow a creature the finesse of a cat. Affected creatures gain Resistance to falling damage and gain Advantage on Dexterity Checks.
variants.description: Creature gains Advantage on Dexterity Checks and only takes half damage from falling.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: When this Spell is cast at 3rd level or higher, you can target an additional creature for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.

variants.name: Eagle's Splendour
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to bestow a creature the elegance of an eagle. Affected creatures gain Advantage on Charisma Checks.
variants.description: Creature gains Advantage on Charisma Checks.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: When this Spell is cast at 3rd level or higher, you can target an additional creature for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.

variants.name: Fox's Cunning
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to bestow a creature the slyness of a fox. Affected creatures gain Advantage on Intelligence Checks.
variants.description: Creature gains Advantage on Intelligence Checks.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: When this Spell is cast at 3rd level or higher, you can target an additional creature for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.

variants.name: Owl's Wisdom
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to bestow a creature the intuition of an owl. Affected creatures gain Advantage on Wisdom Checks.
variants.description: Creature gains Advantage on Wisdom Checks.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: When this Spell is cast at 3rd level or higher, you can target an additional creature for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.

name: Enhance Leap
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to increase a creature's Jumping distance.
description: Triple a creature's Jumping distance.

name: Enlarge/Reduce
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to alter a creature's body size. The caster can choose to double or halve the size of the affected creature.
description:
Make a creature larger or smaller. Either option has a duration of 10 turns.

This affects their weapon damage and Strength Checks and SavingThrows.

variants.name: Enlarge
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to increase a creature's body size. Affected creatures deal more damage with their weapons and gain Advantage on Strength Checks and Saving Throws.
variants.description:
Make a creature larger.

Its weapons deal an extra d4|Physical 1d4 damage. It has Advantage on Strength Checks and SavingThrows.

variants.name: Reduce
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to decrease a creature's body size. Affected creatures deal less damage with their weapons and have Disadvantage on Strength Checks and Saving Throws.
variants.description:
Make a creature smaller.

Its weapons deal d4|Physical 1d4 less damage (minimum of 1 damage). It has Disadvantage on Strength Checks and SavingThrows.

name: Ensnaring Strike
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to use weapon attacks to ensnare enemies with thorny vines and deal Piercing|Piercing damage to them each turn.
description:
Your attack summons thorny vines, dealing Physical|Weapon Damage and possibly Ensnaring your target.

Ensnared creatures cannot move and take 1d6|Piercing damage at the start of each turn. An ally can use their Help Action to try and tear away the vines.
higherLevels: Upcast: Ensnared condition deals an extra 1d6|Piercing damage per level.

variants.name: Ensnaring Strike (Ranged)
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to use ranged weapon attacks to ensnare enemies with thorny vines and deal Piercing|Piercing damage to them each turn.
variants.description:
Your attack summons thorny vines, dealing Physical|Weapon Damage and possibly Ensnaring your target.

Ensnared creatures cannot move and take 1d6|Piercing damage at the start of each turn. An ally can use their Help Action to try and tear away the vines.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: Ensnared condition deals an extra 1d6|Piercing damage per level.

variants.name: Ensnaring Strike (Melee)
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to use melee weapon attacks to ensnare enemies with thorny vines and deal Piercing|Piercing damage to them each turn..
variants.description:
Your attack summons thorny vines, dealing Physical|Weapon Damage and possibly Ensnaring your target.

Ensnared creatures cannot move and take 1d6|Piercing damage at the start of each turn. An ally can use their Help Action to try and tear away the vines.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: Ensnared condition deals an extra 1d6|Piercing damage per level.

name: Entangle
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to conjure magical vines and turn an area within range into difficult terrain. Creatures are possibly Entangled and move at half speed while standing in this area.
description:
Vines sprout from the ground, turning it into Difficult Terrain and possibly Entangling creatures within.

Entangled creatures cannot move. An ally can use its help action to try and tear away the vines.

name: Enthrall
summary: This spells allows spellcasters to capture the attention of a creature, forcing the creature to focus on them.
description: Reduce a creature's peripheral vision and make it look at you.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level doesn't grant any additional benefits.

name: Evard's Black Tentacles
summary: Summons tentacles in an area that make it difficult to move and harm creatures.
description: Tentacles sprout from the ground, turning the area into , attacking and Smothering creatures within.

name: Expeditious Retreat
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to move more swiftly.
description: Gain Dash immediately and as a bonus action on each of your turns until this spell ends.

name: Eyebite
description: Your eyes become black corridors walled in teeth, your gaze capable of inflicting dread, sickness, or putting creatures to sleep.  While Concentrating,  you may cast Eyebite without expending a spell slot.

variants.name: Eyebite: Panicked
variants.summary: This spell allows you to continuously scare enemies over and over for up to 10 turns.
variants.description: Strike Fear deep into a creature's heart.

variants.name: Eyebite: Sickened
variants.summary: This spell makes a target deathly sick every turn.
variants.description: Afflict a creature with Disadvantage on Attack Rolls and Ability Checks.

variants.name: Eyebite: Asleep
variants.summary: This spell allows you to repeatedly force enemies asleep.
variants.description: Put a creature to sleep.

name: Faerie Fire
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to conjure brilliant light. Any creature caught in the radius temporarily sheds faint light and prevents Invisible.
description: All targets within the light turn visible, and Attack Rolls against them have Advantage.

name: False Life
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to gain Temporary Hit Points.
description:
Bolster yourself with a necromantic facsimile of life to gain 7.

Can only have Temporary Hit Points from one source.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level yields an extra 5 for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Fear
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to terrify targets by projecting phantasmal images.
description:
Project an image so frightening it makes targets drop everything and become Fearful. They will be easier to hit and cannot move. If the target ends their turn where they can't see you, they can make another SavingThrow to shake off their fear.

Affected targets become Fearful for 2 turns and Disarmed for 1 turn.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level doesn't grant any additional benefits.

name: Feather Fall
summary: It allows spellcasters to make themselves and their allies light as a feather, preventing them from taking damage when falling from extreme heights.
description: You and nearby allies gain Immunity to Falling damage.

name: Feign Death
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to put their allies into a magical, protective coma, feigning death.
description:
Put an ally in a protective coma. They become Resistant to all damage except Psychic. Disease and Poison no longer have any effect.

Removed when Helped.

name: Find Familiar
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to conjure a fey familiar that can aid them in combat or world exploration.
description: Summon a familiar, a fey spirit that takes an animal form of your choosing

name: Fire Bolt
summary: It allows the caster to hurl a bolt of fire at an enemy.
description: Hurl a mote of fire.
higherLevels:
* When the spellcaster reaches Level 5, the damage increases by another d10|Fire Fire|1d10 Fire damage, for a total of 2d10|Fire.
* When the spellcaster reaches Level 10, the damage increases by another d10|Fire Fire|1d10 Fire damage, for a total of 3d10|Fire.

name: Fire Shield
summary: This spell shields the spellcaster with luminous energy.
description: Wreathe your body in flames that shed light in a ft=10 radius, provide Resistance to Fire or Cold damage, and retaliate against melee attacks.

variants.name: Fire Shield: Warm
variants.summary: This spell shields the spellcaster with scorching flames. It is a variant of Fire Shield
variants.description: Scorching flames shed light in a ft=10 radius. You take only half the damage of all Cold damage, and deal 2d8|Fire damage to anyone who hits you with a melee attack.

variants.name: Fire Shield: Chill
variants.summary: This spell shields the spellcaster with ice-cold flames. It is a variant of Fire Shield.
variants.description: Ice-cold flames shed light in a ft=10 radius. You take only half the damage of all Fire damage, and deal 2d8|Cold damage to anyone who hits you with a melee attack.

name: Fireball
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to unleash a streak of fire from their hands that ignites into a large explosion at a chosen point within range.
description: Shoot a bright flame from your fingers that explodes upon contact, torching everything in the vicinity for 8d6|Fire  damage. On a successful Saving Throw, targets still take half damage.
higherLevels: When the spell is cast using a 4th level slot or higher, damage increases by 1d6|Fire  for each spell slot level above 3rd.

name: Flame Blade
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to summon a fiery scimitar in their free hand that sheds bright light. Casters can make a melee weapon attack with the blade to deal Fire damage to enemies.
description: Conjure a flaming Flame Blade (Weapon)|25|alias=Scimitar in your hand that deals 3d6|Fire damage. It sheds a bright light in a m=3|ft=10 radius and a dim light in a m=6|ft=20 radius. 10.
higherLevels: Upcast: When this spell is cast at 4th Level or higher, damage increases by 1d6|Fire for every two Spell Slot Levels above 2nd.

name: Flame Strike
summary: This spells allows the caster to make a pillar of divine flame at a chosen location dealing   5d6 | Fire damage and  5d6 | Radiant damage.
description: Make a pillar of divine fire roar down from the heavens like the wrath of affronted angels.
higherLevels: Deals an additional  1d6 | Fire damage and  1d6 | Radiant damage for each Spell Slot Level above 5th.

name: Flaming Sphere
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to conjure a Flaming Sphere that can attack and burn enemies.
description: Summon a Flaming Sphere that deals 2d6|Fire damage to nearby enemies and objects. It also sheds bright light in a m=6|ft=20 radius, and dim light for an additional m=6|ft=20. 10.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d6|Fire damage for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.

name: Flesh to Stone
summary: Atrophy a foe, Restraining them until they temporarily turn to stone.
description: Atrophy a foe, Restraining them until they temporarily turn to stone. The target will Petrify if it does not succeed its Saving Throw within 3 turns.

name: Fog Cloud
summary: It allows spellcasters to summon a sphere of fog on an area in range and heavily obscure the area. Creatures within the area are Blinded.
description: Create a cloud of dense fog to Heavily Obscure and Blind creatures within.
higherLevels: Upcast: When this spell is cast at 2nd level or higher, its area of effect increases by 2 m / 7 ft for each spell slot level above 1st.

name: Freedom of Movement
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to imbue an ally with the ability to avoid some slowing effects.
description:
Snap an ally out of any Stun. Difficult Terrain can't slow them down, and they can't be magically Paralysed or Restrained. 

If the target is restrained by non-magical means, it can spend melee of Movement to free itself.

name: Friends
summary: It makes the caster appear more charismatic to the affected creature.
description:
Gain Advantage on Charisma Checks against a non-hostile creature.

In higher difficulty modes, the target might accuse you of enchanting them.

name: Gaseous Form
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to transform themselves or an ally into a cloud of mist to avoid attacks, reduce size, and gain Advantage on some Saving Throws.
description:
Transform yourself or an ally into a tiny gas cloud. It can't fall, and fits through small openings. It is very hard to damage.

The cloud has Advantage on Constitution, Dexterity, and Strength SavingThrows.

While transformed, the target won't be able to attack, cast spells, or talk.

name: Globe of Invulnerability
description: Create a barrier that makes creatures and objects inside it Immune to all damage.

name: Glyph of Warding
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to inscribe a ward that can trigger various magical effects when stepped on by an enemy.
description:
Inscribe a circle of arcane glyphs on the ground. When stepped on by an enemy the selected magical effect will trigger.

The glyph will last until triggered, or until a Long Rest.

Only one glyph can be active at a time.
higherLevels: See each individual variant's page.

variants.name: Glyph of Warding: Sleep
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of the Level 3 Abjuration Spell, Glyph of Warding. This variant of the spell allows spellcasters to inscribe a ward that can put enemies to Sleep when triggered.
variants.description:
The glyph emits a soothing magic that puts everyone within range to Sleep when stepped on by an enemy. Any creatures within the area of effect (that aren't immune to magical sleep) that fail the Dexterity saving throw will be put to Sleep.

The glyph will last until triggered, or until a Long Rest.

Only one glyph can be active at a time.

variants.name: Glyph of Warding: Detonation
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of the Level 3 Abjuration Spell, Glyph of Warding. This variant of the spell allows spellcasters to inscribe a ward that explodes and pushes everyone back when triggered.
variants.description:
The glyph emits a gust of wind that pushes back everyone within range when stepped on by an enemy. Any creatures within the area of effect that fail the Dexterity saving throw will be pushed back.

The glyph will last until triggered, or until a Long Rest.

Only one glyph can be active at a time.

variants.name: Glyph of Warding: Thunder
variants.summary: This spell is a variant of the Level 3 Abjuration Spell, Glyph of Warding. This variant of the spell allows spellcasters to inscribe a ward that explodes and deals Thunder damage to enemies when triggered.
variants.description:
The glyph explodes, dealing Thunder damage to enemies in the vicinity. Creatures who pass the Dexterity saving throw still take half damage. 

The glyph will last until triggered, or until a Long Rest.

Only one glyph can be active at a time.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Thunder damage for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.

The glyph will last until triggered, or until a Long Rest.

Only one glyph can be active at a time.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Lightning damage for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.

The glyph will last until triggered, or until a Long Rest.

variants.higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Fire damage for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.

variants.description:

Only one glyph can be active at a time.
variants.higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Cold damage for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.

variants.summary: This spell is a variant of the Level 3 Abjuration Spell, Glyph of Warding. This variant of the spell allows spellcasters to inscribe a ward that explodes and deals Acid damage to enemies when triggered.
variants.description:
The glyph explodes, dealing Acid damage to enemies in the vicinity. Creatures who pass the Dexterity saving throw still take half damage.

variants.higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Acid damage for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.

name: Goodberry
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to create magical berries which have healing properties when eaten.
description:
Conjure four magical berries for yourself or a companion. Creatures who eat a berry regain 1d4|Healing.
Each berry counts as one Camp Supplies.
The berries appear in the targeted creature's inventory and disappear after a Long Rest.

name: Grant Flight
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to grant a creature they touch the ability to fly.
description: Bestow the ability to Fly upon yourself or an ally.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affects an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 3rd.

name: Grasping Vine
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to summon a Grasping Vine which can pull enemies toward itself.
description:
Summon a giant vine capable of dragging creatures toward itself.

10

name: Grease
summary: It allows spellcasters to conjure flammable grease on the ground within range and turn it into Difficult Terrain.
description: Cover the ground in flammable grease. It becomes Difficult Terrain and creatures within can fall Prone.

name: Greater Invisibility
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to provide a more resilient form of Invisibility for their allies.
description: Turn a creature Invisible. Attacks against it have Disadvantage. It attacks with Advantage. Invisibility breaks when you fail increasingly harder Stealth Ability Checks on attacking, casting spells or interacting with items.

name: Greater Restoration
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to removes Charm, Petrification, Stun, and Curses from a creature.
description: Touch a creature and negate any Charm, Petrification, Stun, or cursed.

name: Guardian of Faith
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to summon a divine guardian who sacrifices its Hit Points to damage enemies.
description: Call forth a divine guardian that attacks nearby enemies. Every time it deals damage, the guardian loses an equal amount of Hit Points. Lasts 10 turns. The guardian is stationary. When an enemy is in range, it uses an attack called "Strike of the Guardian". It has a range of 3m and deals 20 Radiant damage. On a DEX save, enemies still take half damage. It has 60 Hit Points.

name: Guidance
summary: This cantrip allows spellcasters to grant a temporary bonus to a creature's Ability Checks.
description:
The target gains d4|Physical +1d4 bonus to Ability Checks.

10

name: Guiding Bolt
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to hit enemies with radiant bolt that deals Radiant damage and grants Advantage to Attack Roll made against them.
description: The next Attack Roll against this target has Advantage.
higherLevels: Upcast: Deals an additional 1d6|Radiant damage per level.

name: Gust of Wind
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to conjure a squall to clear dangerous gasses or throw creatures back, potentially causing a dangerous fall.
description: Summon a strong wind that clears all clouds. Any creatures caught in the gale who fail a Strength SavingThrow will be pushed back ft=17 and be thrown Off Balance.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level doesn't grant any additional benefits.

name: Hail of Thorns
summary: This spell allows the caster to make a ranged attack that creates a Piercing damage explosion in addition to dealing normal weapon damage.
description: Shoot a volley of thorns. The thorns deal weapon damage to the target and then explode. The explosion deals an additional 1d10|Piercing damage to the target and surrounding creatures. On miss, the thorns still explode. On save, targets still take half damage from the explosion.
higherLevels: * When the spell is cast at 2nd Level or higher, the addition AoE damage increases by 1d10|Piercing for each spell slot level above 1st.

name: Harm
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to make an enemy much more feeble.
description:
Reduce a target's maximum Hit Points, but never below 1.

On Save: Target still takes half damage, but its maximum Hit Points are not reduced.

name: Haste
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to allow their allies to become Hastened.
description:
Target yourself or an ally to become Hastened. The creature has a +2 bonus to Armour Class, Advantage on Dexterity SavingThrows, its Movement Speed is doubled, and can take one additional Action per turn. 

When the condition ends, the creature becomes Lethargic.

name: Heal
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to substantially heal a target by recovering Hit Points and removing Diseases.
description:
Heals a target's wounds and remove Blindness and any Diseases.

No effect on undead and constructs.

name: Healing Word
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to heal allies that they can see within range.
description:
Healing|Heal a creature you can see.

No effect on undead and constructs.
higherLevels: Upcast: Heals an additional 1d4|Healing for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Heat Metal
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to heat up a metal weapon or armour on the targeted creature, forcing them to let go or receive damage or suffer various penalties.
description:
Cause a metal Weapon or Armour to glow red-hot and force the creature touching it to let go or receive Disadvantage on Attack Rolls and Ability Checks. If the creature is only wearing metal armour, it always receives Disadvantage. 

If the creature is still touching the metal, you can use a Bonus Action on subsequent turns to Reapply Heat Metal to deal another 2d8|Fire damage and force the creature to let go or receive Disadvantage.
higherLevels: Upcast: Casting this spell at a higher level deals an extra 1d8|Fire damage for each Spell Slot Level above 2nd.

name: Hellish Rebuke
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to surround a creature in hellfire that deals Fire damage as a Reaction when taking damage from them.
description:
React to your next attacker with flames that deal 2d10|Fire damage. 

On Save: Target still takes half damage.
higherLevels: Upcast: Deals an additional 1d10|Fire damage per level.

name: Heroes' Feast
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to summon a bountiful smorgasbord to bolster themselves and their allies and strengthen their resolve.
description: You and everyone around can't be Poisoned, Diseased, or Frightened. Everyone's maximum Hit Points increases by 12, and they make Wisdom SavingThrows with Advantage.

name: Heroism
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to instill themselves or an ally with courage. The affected creature cannot be Frightened and gains Temporary Hit Points.
description:
Make yourself or a target immune to Frightened and gain 5 Temporary Hit Points each turn.

Can only have Temporary Hit Points from one source.
higherLevels: Upcast: Affects an additional target for each Spell Slot Level above 1st.

name: Hex
summary: This spell allows spellcasters to put a curse on a creature and deal additional Necrotic damage to the targeted creature. The curse also imposes Disadvantage on a chosen ability check.
description:
Make your attacks deal an additional 1d6|Necrotic Necrotic|damage damage [sic] to the target and give it Disadvantage on Checks on an Ability of your choosing.

If the target dies before the spell ends, you can Reapply Hex to a new creature without expending a Spell Slot.

variants.name: Hex (Strength)
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to put a curse on a creature and deal additional Necrotic damage to them. The curse also imposes Disadvantage on the creature's Strength checks.
variants.description: Deal an additional 1d6|Necrotic Necrotic|damage when you attack the target and impart Disadvantage on Strength Checks.

variants.name: Hex (Dexterity)
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to put a curse on a creature and deal additional Necrotic damage to them. The curse also imposes Disadvantage on the creature's Dexterity checks.
variants.description: Deal an additional 1d6|Necrotic Necrotic|damage when you attack the target and impart Disadvantage on Dexterity Checks.

variants.name: Hex (Constitution)
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to put a curse on a creature and deal additional Necrotic damage to them. The curse also imposes Disadvantage on the creature's Constitution checks.
variants.description: Deal an additional 1d6|Necrotic Necrotic|damage when you attack the target and impart Disadvantage on Constitution Checks.

variants.name: Hex (Intelligence)
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to put a curse on a creature and deal additional Necrotic damage to them. The curse also imposes Disadvantage on the creature's Intelligence checks.
variants.description: Deal an additional 1d6|Necrotic Necrotic|damage when you attack the target and impart Disadvantage on Intelligence Checks.

variants.name: Hex (Wisdom)
variants.summary: This spell allows spellcasters to put a curse on a creature and deal additional Necrotic damage to them. The curse also imposes Disadvantage on the creature's Wisdom checks.
variants.description: Deal an additional 1d6|Necrotic Necrotic|damage when you attack the target and impart Disadvantage on Wisdom Checks.
